reference.title: derby.authentication.builtin.iterations
reference.shortdesc: The derby.authentication.builtin.iterations property specifies the number of times to apply the hash function (which is specified by the derby.authentication.builtin.algorithm property) on the credentials.

section.p: Iteration slows down attackers by forcing them to spend more time calculating hashes. See for more information.
This property is in effect only if NATIVE authentication is specified by the derby.authentication.provider property and if the derby.authentication.builtin.algorithm property has a non-null value.

codeblock.b:
-- system-wide property derby.authentication.builtin.iterations=2000
-- database-level property CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.authentication.builtin.iterations', '2000');

section.title: Dynamic or static
section.p: Dynamic; the change takes effect immediately. For information about dynamic changes to properties, see .
